Public MustInherit Class DbSet Inherits DbQuery

Docs.summary: A non-generic version of which can be used when the type of entity is not known at build time.

Docs.summary: Creates an instance of a when called from the constructor of a derived type that will be used as a test double for DbSets. Methods and properties that will be used by the test double must be implemented by the test double except AsNoTracking, AsStreaming, an Include where the default implementation is a no-op.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual object Add (object entity);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance object Add(object entity) cil managed
Public Overridable Function Add (entity As Object) As Object
abstract member Add : obj -> obj override this.Add : obj -> obj

Docs.summary: Adds the given entity to the context underlying the set in the Added state such that it will be inserted into the database when SaveChanges is called.
Docs.remarks: Note that entities that are already in the context in some other state will have their state set to Added. Add is a no-op if the entity is already in the context in the Added state.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual System.Collections.IEnumerable AddRange (System.Collections.IEnumerable entities);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Collections.IEnumerable AddRange(class System.Collections.IEnumerable entities) cil managed
Public Overridable Function AddRange (entities As IEnumerable) As IEnumerable
abstract member AddRange : System.Collections.IEnumerable -> System.Collections.IEnumerable override this.AddRange : System.Collections.IEnumerable -> System.Collections.IEnumerable

Docs.param: The collection of entities to add.
Docs.summary: Adds the given collection of entities into context underlying the set with each entity being put into the Added state such that it will be inserted into the database when SaveChanges is called.
Docs.remarks: Note that if is set to true (which is the default), then DetectChanges will be called once before adding any entities and will not be called again. This means that in some situations AddRange may perform significantly better than calling Add multiple times would do. Note that entities that are already in the context in some other state will have their state set to Added. AddRange is a no-op for entities that are already in the context in the Added state.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual object Attach (object entity);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance object Attach(object entity) cil managed
Public Overridable Function Attach (entity As Object) As Object
abstract member Attach : obj -> obj override this.Attach : obj -> obj

Docs.summary: Attaches the given entity to the context underlying the set. That is, the entity is placed into the context in the Unchanged state, just as if it had been read from the database.
Docs.remarks: Attach is used to repopulate a context with an entity that is known to already exist in the database. SaveChanges will therefore not attempt to insert an attached entity into the database because it is assumed to already be there. Note that entities that are already in the context in some other state will have their state set to Unchanged. Attach is a no-op if the entity is already in the context in the Unchanged state.

Docs.summary: Creates a new instance of an entity for the type of this set. Note that this instance is NOT added or attached to the set. The instance returned will be a proxy if the underlying context is configured to create proxies and the entity type meets the requirements for creating a proxy.
Docs.returns: The entity instance, which may be a proxy.

Docs.param: The type of entity to create.
Docs.summary: Creates a new instance of an entity for the type of this set or for a type derived from the type of this set. Note that this instance is NOT added or attached to the set. The instance returned will be a proxy if the underlying context is configured to create proxies and the entity type meets the requirements for creating a proxy.
Docs.returns: The entity instance, which may be a proxy.

public virtual object Find (params object[] keyValues);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance object Find(object[] keyValues) cil managed
Public Overridable Function Find (ParamArray keyValues As Object()) As Object
abstract member Find : obj[] -> obj override this.Find : obj[] -> obj

Docs.param: The values of the primary key for the entity to be found.
Docs.summary: Finds an entity with the given primary key values. If an entity with the given primary key values exists in the context, then it is returned immediately without making a request to the store. Otherwise, a request is made to the store for an entity with the given primary key values and this entity, if found, is attached to the context and returned. If no entity is found in the context or the store, then null is returned.
Docs.remarks: The ordering of composite key values is as defined in the EDM, which is in turn as defined in the designer, by the Code First fluent API, or by the DataMember attribute.
Docs.exception: Thrown if the context has been disposed.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual System.Threading.Tasks.Task<object> FindAsync (params object[] keyValues);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Threading.Tasks.Task`1<object> FindAsync(object[] keyValues) cil managed
Public Overridable Function FindAsync (ParamArray keyValues As Object()) As Task(Of Object)
abstract member FindAsync : obj[] -> System.Threading.Tasks.Task<obj> override this.FindAsync : obj[] -> System.Threading.Tasks.Task<obj>

Docs.param: The values of the primary key for the entity to be found.
Docs.summary: Asynchronously finds an entity with the given primary key values. If an entity with the given primary key values exists in the context, then it is returned immediately without making a request to the store. Otherwise, a request is made to the store for an entity with the given primary key values and this entity, if found, is attached to the context and returned. If no entity is found in the context or the store, then null is returned.
Docs.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous find operation. The task result contains the entity found, or null.
Docs.remarks: The ordering of composite key values is as defined in the EDM, which is in turn as defined in the designer, by the Code First fluent API, or by the DataMember attribute. Multiple active operations on the same context instance are not supported. Use 'await' to ensure that any asynchronous operations have completed before calling another method on this context.
Docs.exception: Thrown if the context has been disposed.

Docs.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous find operation. The task result contains the entity found, or null.
Docs.remarks: The ordering of composite key values is as defined in the EDM, which is in turn as defined in the designer, by the Code First fluent API, or by the DataMember attribute. Multiple active operations on the same context instance are not supported. Use 'await' to ensure that any asynchronous operations have completed before calling another method on this context.
Docs.exception: Thrown if the context has been disposed.

public virtual System.Collections.IList Local { get; }
.property instance class System.Collections.IList Local
Public Overridable ReadOnly Property Local As IList
member this.Local : System.Collections.IList

Docs.summary: Gets an that represents a local view of all Added, Unchanged, and Modified entities in this set. This local view will stay in sync as entities are added or removed from the context. Likewise, entities added to or removed from the local view will automatically be added to or removed from the context.
Docs.remarks: This property can be used for data binding by populating the set with data, for example by using the Load extension method, and then binding to the local data through this property. For WPF bind to this property directly. For Windows Forms bind to the result of calling ToBindingList on this property

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual object Remove (object entity);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance object Remove(object entity) cil managed
Public Overridable Function Remove (entity As Object) As Object
abstract member Remove : obj -> obj override this.Remove : obj -> obj

Docs.summary: Marks the given entity as Deleted such that it will be deleted from the database when SaveChanges is called. Note that the entity must exist in the context in some other state before this method is called.
Docs.remarks: Note that if the entity exists in the context in the Added state, then this method will cause it to be detached from the context. This is because an Added entity is assumed not to exist in the database such that trying to delete it does not make sense.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual System.Collections.IEnumerable RemoveRange (System.Collections.IEnumerable entities);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Collections.IEnumerable RemoveRange(class System.Collections.IEnumerable entities) cil managed
Public Overridable Function RemoveRange (entities As IEnumerable) As IEnumerable
abstract member RemoveRange : System.Collections.IEnumerable -> System.Collections.IEnumerable override this.RemoveRange : System.Collections.IEnumerable -> System.Collections.IEnumerable

Docs.param: The collection of entities to delete.
Docs.summary: Removes the given collection of entities from the context underlying the set with each entity being put into the Deleted state such that it will be deleted from the database when SaveChanges is called.
Docs.remarks: Note that if is set to true (which is the default), then DetectChanges will be called once before delete any entities and will not be called again. This means that in some situations RemoveRange may perform significantly better than calling Remove multiple times would do. Note that if any entity exists in the context in the Added state, then this method will cause it to be detached from the context. This is because an Added entity is assumed not to exist in the database such that trying to delete it does not make sense.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual System.Data.Entity.Infrastructure.DbSqlQuery SqlQuery (string sql, params object[] parameters);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Data.Entity.Infrastructure.DbSqlQuery SqlQuery(string sql, object[] parameters) cil managed
Public Overridable Function SqlQuery (sql As String, ParamArray parameters As Object()) As DbSqlQuery
abstract member SqlQuery : string * obj[] -> System.Data.Entity.Infrastructure.DbSqlQuery override this.SqlQuery : string * obj[] -> System.Data.Entity.Infrastructure.DbSqlQuery

Docs.param: The parameters to apply to the SQL query string. If output parameters are used, their values will not be available until the results have been read completely. This is due to the underlying behavior of DbDataReader, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=398589 for more details.
Docs.summary:
Creates a raw SQL query that will return entities in this set. By default, the entities returned are tracked by the context; this can be changed by calling AsNoTracking on the returned. Note that the entities returned are always of the type for this set and never of a derived type. If the table or tables queried may contain data for other entity types, then the SQL query must be written appropriately to ensure that only entities of the correct type are returned.
As with any API that accepts SQL it is important to parameterize any user input to protect against a SQL injection attack. You can include parameter place holders in the SQL query string and then supply parameter values as additional arguments. Any parameter values you supply will automatically be converted to a DbParameter. context.Set(typeof(Blog)).SqlQuery("SELECT * FROM dbo.Posts WHERE Author = @p0", userSuppliedAuthor); Alternatively, you can also construct a DbParameter and supply it to SqlQuery. This allows you to use named parameters in the SQL query string. context.Set(typeof(Blog)).SqlQuery("SELECT * FROM dbo.Posts WHERE Author = @author", new SqlParameter("@author", userSuppliedAuthor));
Docs.returns: A object that will execute the query when it is enumerated.
